page.title: Mood & Social
page.subtitle: How Kava lifts the mood, creates euphoria, and promotes social interactions.

intro.paragraph1: Kava is not just a relaxant – it is a social drink. For thousands of years, it has been consumed in the Pacific during ceremonies, gatherings, and social occasions. Its mood-enhancing and socially opening effects make it a unique "social lubricant" – without the downsides of alcohol.
intro.paragraph2: The effect is often described as euphoria without intoxication: One feels good, open, and talkative, while maintaining full control and mental clarity.

mechanismen.title: Neurobiological Foundations
mechanismen.intro: The mood-enhancing effect of Kava is based on several neurobiological mechanisms that go beyond mere GABA modulation.

dopamin.title: Dopamine System
dopamin.description: Some Kavalactones, particularly Yangonin (6) and Desmethoxyyangonin (1), show interactions with dopamine receptors. Dopamine is the "reward neurotransmitter" responsible for motivation, joy, and well-being. This interaction explains the mood-enhancing and slightly euphoric effects.

endocannabinoid.title: Endocannabinoid System
endocannabinoid.description: Yangonin has a demonstrated affinity for the CB1 receptor of the endocannabinoid system. This explains the mildly euphoric, relaxing effect that some users compare to a mild cannabis-like feeling – but without the psychedelic component and with full clarity.

maob.title: MAO-B Inhibition
maob.description: Particularly Desmethoxyyangonin inhibits the enzyme monoamine oxidase-B (MAO-B). This slows the breakdown of dopamine in the brain and prolongs its effect. The result: sustained good mood and a sense of well-being.

noradrenalin.title: Norepinephrine Modulation
noradrenalin.description: The inhibition of norepinephrine reuptake contributes to a feeling of alert attention. One is relaxed but not tired – ideal for conversations and social interactions.

mechanismen.quote: Some Kavalactones (especially Yangonin and Desmethoxyyangonin) show interactions with dopamine and norepinephrine receptors – this can promote mood-enhancing, motivating effects.

euphorie.title: The Kava Euphoria
euphorie.intro: The euphoric component of Kava is subtle but distinctly noticeable. It fundamentally differs from the euphoria caused by alcohol or other substances.
kavaPoints: No disinhibition or loss of control
alkoholPoints: Can tilt towards aggression or sadness
euphorie.outro: The Kava euphoria is often described as "contented serenity." One feels good in their skin, accepts the situation as it is, and has a natural interest in other people. Worries and ruminations fade into the background.

sozial.title: Social Effects
sozial.intro: In the Pacific Islands, Kava is the social drink par excellence. It is consumed during gatherings, peace negotiations, weddings, and everyday meetings. The social effect is a central aspect of the Kava experience.
sozial.barKulturText: In the USA and increasingly in Europe, Kava bars are emerging as an alternative to alcohol bars. The atmosphere is typically calmer and more conversation-oriented. Instead of loud music and disinhibition, one finds deep conversations and genuine connections. Many people who do not wish to drink alcohol find a social alternative here.
sozial.quote: The effects are not intoxicating, but centripetal, calming, and connecting. The combination with mindful settings (e.g., music, candlelight, natural surroundings) seems to deepen the effect.

chemotypen.title: Recommended Chemotypes & Varieties
chemotypen.intro: For mood-enhancing and social effects, "Heady" varieties with high kavain and yangonin content are ideal. These primarily act mentally and keep one awake and talkative.

varieties.name: Kelai (Vanuatu)
varieties.description: Very popular for social situations. Lifts the mood and makes one talkative.

varieties.name: Melo Melo (Vanuatu)
varieties.description: Slightly euphoric, ideal for social evenings.

varieties.name: Pouni Ono (Tonga)
varieties.description: Premium quality, known for its mood-enhancing effect.

varieties.name: Moi (Hawaii)
varieties.description: Hawaiian variety, gently euphoric and socially opening.

chemotypen.tipText: Look for Kavain (4) in positions 1-2 and Yangonin (6) in the front range. This combination provides the best mood-enhancing effect. Avoid very DHK-heavy varieties (2 in position 1), as these tend to be sedating.

anwendung.title: Practical Application
anwendung.intro: For social occasions and mood enhancement, there are some recommendations:
anwendung.settingIntro: The effect of Kava is strongly influenced by the setting. For optimal social and mood-enhancing effects:

settingItems.label: Atmosphere
settingItems.value: Relaxed environment, dim lighting, pleasant music

settingItems.label: Activity
settingItems.value: Conversations, listening to music, nature experiences

settingItems.label: Mindset
settingItems.value: Open and curious, not stressed or rushed

anwendung.quote: For starting the day / focus / social activity: Heady Kava like Borogu or Kelai. Effect: mentally clear, mood-enhancing. Ideal for creative work, social gatherings, nature experiences.
